expression: hit the nail on the head

selectionMeta.selectedPhrase: hit the nail on the head

step1.sentence: When Sara said the project failed because of poor communication, she hit the nail on the head.

step2.story: The team had been debating the cause of their low sales for an hour. David finally said it was the pricing strategy, and the room went quiet — he had hit the nail on the head.

step3.story: The marketing team had struggled for weeks to pinpoint why their campaign underperformed. Consultants suggested dozens of theories about timing, budget, and creative direction. Then a junior analyst quietly noted that the target audience simply did not use that social platform anymore. The manager nodded slowly — the analyst had hit the nail on the head, and everyone else had been overthinking it.

meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 사실이나 문제의 핵심을 정확하게 짚어낼 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 16세기부터 사용된 표현으로, 목수가 못을 정확히 박는 기술에서 비롯되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 칭찬의 뉘앙스가 강하며, 오랜 논의 끝에 누군가가 결정적인 발언을 했을 때 자주 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: You hit the nail on the head — that is exactly the problem.
